 A simple restatement: Adding up 35 + 15 + 20 is less than the duration of the movie, because 5 minutes has been added to the total duration. The 20 minutes that were uninterrupted is a surprise: it seems to add more to the total than it does, since it takes up about half of the total. After all, if it is 5 minutes per rewind, that means if the film was 50 minutes long, then there would be 20 times 5 = 100 minutes. But the film only takes up 75 minutes. Thus we need to add 5 minutes to the total.
Amaya played the movie 35 minutes, remaining uninterrupted for the next 20 minutes, rewound and re-watched another 15 minutes, and further added 5 minutes for the process of watching it. The total time was 45 + 35 + 20 + 5 = 65.
 A few years ago Amaya looked up watching time for movies and found that a 40 minute movie takes about 90 minutes to watch. Using the formula: T = S + (R x F), where T = total time in minutes; S = seconds played (35); R = total times she had to rewind the movie (5 x 2); F = time to rewind the movie again (15); she found that T = (S + (R x F) = 90 + (5 x 2 x 15) = 155. Now using the formula T = [(90 - S) + F] = 155 - 30 = 125. So, she finished the movie in about 125 minutes.</s>
 1 + 2 + 3 + 5 + 15 = 42 minutes. That's the total duration of the movie plus all the times she had to rewind and re-watch parts. The total time would have been 41 minutes had she not needed to rewind.
